clinical_study.brief_title: Quantitative Evaluation of Muscle Tone Using Elastic Ultrasound
clinical_study.official_title: Study on Quantitative Evaluation of Muscle Tone Using Elastic Ultrasound

brief_summary.textblock: The test subjects were selected from patients with clinical manifestations in muscle tone and healthy volunteers. Target muscles includes elbow flexor, elbow extensor, plantar flexor and ankle dorsi flexor. Thirty patients and 10 healthy subjects were given three assessment methods to measure muscle tension: modified Ashworth rating scale, elastic ultrasound technology and surface electromyography, and the data obtained by these three methods will be statistically analyzed and discussed.

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: Modified Ashworth Scale of the target muscles

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year

study_pop.textblock: This study is expected to recruit 30 patients and 10 healthy subjects with clinical changes in flexion of the elbow flexor group (biceps, brachialis) to participate in the study.
